title: Climbing Plants Quiz
description: Vines and climbers add vertical beauty to gardens! Test your knowledge of these plants that reach for the sky.

questions.question: Which climbing plant is famous for covering the walls of old English cottages and universities?
What fragrant climbing plant has clusters of tubular white flowers and is associated with warm summer evenings?
Which vigorous climbing plant produces long, hanging clusters of purple or white flowers in spring?
The Clematis vine is nicknamed the "Queen of" what?
Which climbing plant produces the passion fruit and has elaborate, intricate flowers?
How does English Ivy attach itself to walls and surfaces?
Which climbing plant produces large, trumpet-shaped orange flowers and is a hummingbird favorite?
What popular annual climbing vine opens its blue, purple, or pink funnel-shaped flowers each morning?
Virginia Creeper is often confused with Poison Ivy. How many leaflets does Virginia Creeper have per leaf?
Which climbing plant is grown commercially for its cone-shaped flowers used in brewing beer?
What fragrant climbing annual produces ruffled flowers in many colors and is popular in cottage gardens?
Which tropical climbing plant has brightly colored papery bracts and thrives in hot, dry climates?
The Grape Vine has been cultivated for wine production for approximately how long?
Which climbing hydrangea is unusual because it can climb shady walls where few other climbers thrive?
What is the term for a garden structure specifically designed to support climbing plants overhead?
